intro: Orophea stenogyna, commonly known as the narrow-leaved orophea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments within rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
